summary: This bill, the Bridging Agency Data Gaps and Ensuring Safety for Native Communities Act (BADGES for Native Communities Act), aims to improve safety and address data gaps within Native communities. Key provisions include requiring federal law enforcement agencies to report on missing and murdered Indigenous persons, establishing a Tribal facilitator for the National Missing and Unidentified Persons System, and authorizing grants for programs related to missing persons cases and sexual violence investigations. The bill also mandates studies and coordination for improved law enforcement resources and mental health support for officers.
